etymology.interpretation: 母 provides the pronunciation, while the top element—interpreted as a sprout or bamboo hairpin—adds a semantic layer tied to maturity or individuation. That imagery was later abstracted into the distributive sense of counting items one by one, yielding the meaning “each/every.”

examples.chinese: 每个人都喜欢音乐(每個人都喜歡音樂)。
examples.pinyin: Měi gè rén dōu xǐhuan yīnyuè.

examples.chinese: 我们每天学习两个小时(我們每天學習兩個小時)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen měi tiān xuéxí liǎng gè xiǎoshí.
examples.english: We study for two hours every day.

examples.chinese: 每次遇到问题(每次遇到問題)，他都会询问老师(他都會詢問老師)。
examples.pinyin: Měi cì yùdào wèntí, tā dōu huì xúnwèn lǎoshī.
examples.english: Every time he runs into a problem, he asks the teacher.
